TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed GregorianCalendarTypes extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Defines the different language versions of the Gregorian calendar.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The date and time patterns associated with the <xref:System.Globalization.GregorianCalendar> vary depending on the language. If the <xref:System.Globalization.GregorianCalendar> is selected in <xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Calendar%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Globalization.GregorianCalendarTypes> can be used to specify which date and time patterns to use in that <xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo>.
For Arabic cultures, more language versions of the Gregorian calendar are available. For example, you can use the French version of <xref:System.Globalization.GregorianCalendar> using the MiddleEastFrench value.
A culture that supports <xref:System.Globalization.GregorianCalendarTypes.MiddleEastFrench> might not support all language versions of <xref:System.Globalization.GregorianCalendar>. The <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.Calendar%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.OptionalCalendars%2A?displayProperty=fullName> properties specify the calendars supported by that culture. If <xref:System.Globalization.GregorianCalendar> is supported, <xref:System.Globalization.GregorianCalendar.CalendarType%2A> can be used to determine which language versions of <xref:System.Globalization.GregorianCalendar.CalendarType%2A> are supported.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to determine the GregorianCalendar language version supported by the culture.
[!code-cpp[System.Globalization.GregorianCalendarTypes#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.GregorianCalendarTypes/CPP/gregoriancalendartypes.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.GregorianCalendarTypes#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.GregorianCalendarTypes/CS/gregoriancalendartypes.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.GregorianCalendarTypes#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.GregorianCalendarTypes/VB/gregoriancalendartypes.vb#1)]
The following code example prints a <xref:System.DateTime> using a <xref:System.Globalization.GregorianCalendar> that is localized.
[!code-cpp[System.Globalization.GregorianCalendarLocalized#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.GregorianCalendarLocalized/CPP/gregorianlocalized.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.GregorianCalendarLocalized#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.GregorianCalendarLocalized/CS/gregorianlocalized.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.GregorianCalendarLocalized#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.GregorianCalendarLocalized/VB/gregorianlocalized.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.GregorianCalendarTypes Arabic = int32(10)

Docs.summary: Refers to the Arabic version of the Gregorian calendar.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.GregorianCalendarTypes Localized = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Refers to the localized version of the Gregorian calendar, based on the language of the that uses the .

Docs.summary: Refers to the Middle East French version of the Gregorian calendar.

Docs.summary: Refers to the transliterated English version of the Gregorian calendar.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.GregorianCalendarTypes TransliteratedFrench = int32(12)

Docs.summary: Refers to the transliterated French version of the Gregorian calendar.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.GregorianCalendarTypes USEnglish = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Refers to the U.S. English version of the Gregorian calendar.
